description: Let k be largest number such that k^2 divides n! and let m be largest number such that m! divides k; a(n) = k/m!.
formula: a(n)=A000188(n!)/H!, where H!>=Floor[n/2]! is here the maximal factorial divisor.
example: n=11, 11!=6!*6!*77 and the largest square root divisor is 6!>Floor[11/2]! a(11)=77, the quotient.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 25 2000
